author: jochembrouwer
content: Hi all, I was rather sure about the decisions regarding Shandong yesterday but I am not anymore. Do we want 1153 on Shandong?

author: jochembrouwer
content: I am new to this ACD call process, but I think what we should at least do is to create a "decision sheet" of whatever is decided at the ACD ASAP, so we can all agree after the ACD whatever was discussed and focus on that (for instance, at this point, I do not exactly know how some of the EIP states changed - did they get CFId or not? - I should have taken better notes myself anyways, but it should still be at a central (... hah ðŸ˜… ) point such that we can all agree on these notes/decisions)

author: _shemnon
content: There was no decision if 1153 should go into shandong.  Perhaps we need a #shandong channel in the R&D discord and make the decision there?

author: timbeiko
content: Figuring out testnets plans was on the agenda, but we didn't have time to discuss on the call, unfortunately. I'd use <#892088344438255616>  (or this channel?) if we want to discuss it async in the meantime.

author: timbeiko
content:
yeah, that's fair - we used to do this in the past and have them as part of the transcripts. It felt a bit bureaucratic at times to do, and we eventually drop it, but we could fairly easily bring it back. 

For the last call, I believe the only "explicit" decision we made was to move 1153 to CFI. I usually try and post PRs up for these things right after and share them here, but I was travelling yesterday and <@383836935480803339> offered to open it but wasn't sure how to proceed, so was blocked on me.

author: timbeiko
content: Another thing where we can perhaps improve is that because we do full transcripts for ACD, they usually take a few days to be uploaded/merged in the `/pm` repo. This means it might be easiest to separate a lightweight "decision summary" from a full transcript.

author: timbeiko
content: V1 of this might just be posting a list of decisions in the discord here after the call? And then we can record them more permanently in the transcript?
